description: Primes p such that x^48 = 2 has no solution mod p, but x^24 = 2 has a solution mod p.
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..188
mathematica: Select[Prime[Range[PrimePi[30000]]], ! MemberQ[PowerMod[Range[#], 48, #], Mod[2, #]] && MemberQ[PowerMod[Range[#], 24, #], Mod[2, #]] &] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 22 2013 *)
prog: (MAGMA) [p: p in PrimesUpTo(30000) | not exists{x: x in ResidueClassRing(p) | x^48 eq 2} and exists{x: x in ResidueClassRing(p) | x^24 eq 2}]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 21 2012
author: _Klaus Brockhaus_, Feb 04 2001
